file_content.text: I can't wait to get off this waste of a planet.
Glad that's over! Now, what do we do with the scientist, huh?
We just have to get that sponsorship token!
Hey, girl, it's Mako. Got some information for you.
Hey, it's Mako. Got some information for you.
Did you find out more about the Great Hunt or Braden's killer?
Anything good?
That and more. I've been a busy girl.
How are you holding up, Mako?
Are you okay?
Better, now that I've got a lead.
I'm in the middle of killing people for credits right now.
I'm busy.
Sorry to distract you, but there is that whole thing with the Great Hunt and Braden's murder.
The man who killed Braden really was Tarro Blood, a big shot from Alderaan.
After he washed out of the last Great Hunt, Tarro spent years building up support with the Mandalorians.
What about this mysterious competition? Rules, anything?
My interest is the Great Hunt.
I'm getting to it.
And?
Why would Tarro Blood need support from the other Mandalorians?
Building support?
The Great Hunt is a Mandalorian tradition. Entry rules are different for their people. Since Tarro's a Mandalorian, he competes with them to enter.
Now he's buying off the other Mandalorians so they don't gang up on him again.
A coward and a cheat. This scum dies.
Despicable.
I'll avenge Braden no matter who I have to go through.
He killed Braden, he dies.
That's what I like to hear.
This is too much to think about.
My head is swimming.
For now, concentrate on impressing Nem'ro. His sponsorship is your only chance of getting close to Tarro Blood.
Oh, one more thing....
I don't have a lot of time, Mako.
Make it quick.
Whoa. Starting to believe your own hype there, "Mr. I'm so important"?
You want me to tell Nem'ro how you feel about him?
You're in love.
You are so gross. Funny, but gross. Now be serious a minute.
You can't deny your pent-up feelings towards me?
You're in love.
What? No! I mean, shut up! You're insane. Focus on the issues at hand.
Is it important?
It may be. Or not. I don't know.
While I was out taking care of... saying goodbye to Braden and Jory... I caught someone following me.
He was dressed like some offworld tribesman. Tall. Wore a white bone mask, like a death's head.
I'll keep an eye out for him. He might be trouble.
Good to know.
Gave me the major creeps.
This fella try to come after you?
What did he do?
No, but he could tell I spotted him.
I'll put him on my "to kill" list.
He won't bother you again.
You are so fantastically simple sometimes.
Anyway, eyes open. Go show that Hutt who's the best bounty hunter in the galaxy.
You've got to get to Nem'ro before he realizes you don't have a crew anymore.
If Blood's determined to win the Great Hunt, our best bet of catching up to him is getting you into that competition.
I'm here to win the Great Hunt. That hasn't changed.
Blood can't scare me off.
Makes sense.
If it means finding Braden's killer, I'll burn down all of Hutta.
Braden deserves justice.
I appreciate that--Braden was like a father to me. He didn't deserve this. Neither did poor, greedy Jory.
The thing is, Braden spent all our credits getting us here. We're stuck on this stupid planet.
Nem'ro the Hutt is the only boss with enough clout to sponsor you for the Great Hunt. We need him more than ever.
Just point me in the right direction.
Then let's move.
We should track Braden's killers. They can't have gotten far.
We need revenge--now.
Tarro Blood owns a starship. He could be halfway across the galaxy by now. We don't even have a shuttle pass out of here.
I just walk in and ask Nem'ro to sponsor me?
So I go chat up the Hutt?
Basically, yeah. Not much of a plan, but it's all we've got.
If nobody knows Braden is... is dead, I should be able to get you a meeting with Nem'ro.
This will take every favor I can call in. And I'll need the tags from your bounty--should be enough for two burials....
I didn't know them well, but I'd still like to pay my respects.
I'd like to be there.
No time. You have to get to Nem'ro fast. Braden would understand--and Jory would insist.
Take care of it.
I'll do something nice for them--at least, as nice as I can manage on this cesspool of a planet.
If it isn't, the swamp creatures get a special treat.
Whatever, let them rot.
You're absolutely horrible. Just give me the blasted tags.
I did everything I could to build your reputation, but now you'll have to make an even bigger impression.
Nem'ro's enemies are all over town. Take out some leaders before you visit the palace, and you'll score points with the Hutt.
Nothing wrong with a little target practice.
I'd shoot them anyway.
Just don't get yourself killed. I... well... you're all I've got, now.
Are you going to be alright, Mako?
What about you?
Just... just focus on the Great Hunt. That's what matters now.
Just because Braden's dead doesn't mean you're in charge.
You're getting pretty bossy.
I'd like to bury my friends now, if it's okay with you....
Hey, old-timers, I'm... Jory! Braden!
What happened? Is the old man...?
He looks pretty dead. Jory, too.
They're gone.
Somebody is going to pay for this.
This won't go unpunished.
No. The old man's really dead? But he... oh... damn it!
Calm down, breathe for a second.
Take it easy.
Don't treat me like a child! Braden's dead! He's, oh, he's really....
Wait, you had something to do with this!
If I did, you'd be dead, too.
Stop and think.
Are you crazy? Why would I kill them?
With what motivation?
Watch your mouth, little girl. Remember who you're talking to.
Back off.
I'm sorry. I don't know what came over me. It's just... I've been with Braden for years.
I-I know you didn't have any reason to hurt him. I just can't believe he's gone.
I guess this is my welcome to the business.
What's done is done.
It's never easy seeing friends die, Mako.
It's normal to be shocked.
I just never imagined... but I can handle this. I can.
There must be some way to find out what happened.
We need action here.
You're right, there is.
Jory and I set up surveillance gear all over this room. Whatever happened here should've been recorded.
Fire up that monitor. Let's figure out who did this!
Whoever did this is a walking dead man.
Then, we have our vengeance.
I'm with you there. Let's see that monitor.
This must have something to do with the Great Hunt.
I doubt it was robbery.
Maybe. That monitor will tell us for sure, though.
You don't give the orders here.
Watch that tone.
Whatever, just turn on the monitor already!
Blast it, someone's tampered with the recording. I can still get some of it, though. Here we go....
Move, and you're dead. Now, if you know what's good for you, you're gonna back out nice and slow.
Oh, I know precisely what's good for me. Winning the Great Hunt won't merely be good--it will be splendid.
When I win, the entire galaxy will know the name Tarro Blood--and I'll charge extravagant fees for my services. Won't I, Sedyn?
The highest in the galaxy. Only the filthy rich will be able to afford you.
Tarro Blood? I've heard of you. Nearly got crippled by the other Mandalorians at the Great Hunt ten years back.
Ah, yes. That. An unfortunate bit of history. This time, I plan to win.
Of course, that will be simpler if my competition doesn't include rivals beyond my fellow Mandalorians.
The Twi'lek vibroblade master from Ord Mantell? Gone. The Chiss droid builder fond of explosives? Gone. That just leaves your protege to remove.
Then your mission is a failure. Your quarry is not here--and now revealed, your hunt has failed!
You misunderstand. The rules forbid killing competitors before the allotted hour. Thus, the promising up-and-comers I mentioned are very much alive.
I simply eliminated them as threats. And how does one slow a charging gundark, Sedyn?
Blast his legs out from under him.
Destroy the upstart's so-called crew. I'll be outside, innocently unaware.
Jory! Shoot to kill!
Too late, old man!
That scum! He didn't even have the guts to kill them himself. He had his lackeys do it, the coward!
Did you recognize any of them?
Who were they?
Not their faces, but I know the name they kept throwing around.
This can't be easy for you, Mako. I'm truly sorry.
My sympathies.
Braden wouldn't want me wasting time on tears. We need to think this through.
They killed Jory and Braden to keep me out of the Great Hunt.
This was about me.
Then let's make sure that doesn't happen.
The big-mouth running the show claimed he was Tarro Blood. He's a big shot even for a Mandalorian.
When he started out, Tarro Blood was major news. Rumor says everyone united against him when he tried the Great Hunt.
This time he's stacking the deck in his favor.
So now he cheats.
If what he said was true, he's already nixed some other competitors.
Unbelievable. He seems like such a likable fellow.
I'm not shocked.
Apparently, he crossed his fellow Mandalorians. No one knows exactly how or why, but everyone sure knows the results.
We need to find this man, Mako. He needs to die.
Time for revenge.
The old man always said this is a thinking job. Know your enemy, then target his weakness.
Tarro Blood barely survived elimination from the Great Hunt last time. He was out on his back for years. Major squash, you know?
Watch yourself--that Vexx sounds nasty!
Watch yourself out there.
Move along, creepy.
The monitor will tell us what happened to Jory and Braden.
